thread.title: Red Shirts leader Jamal Yunos remanded for five days
thread.title_full: Red Shirts leader Jamal Yunos remanded for five days

author: FARIK ZOLKEPLI
title: Red Shirts leader Jamal Yunos remanded for five days
text: Friday, 3 February 2017 | MYT 11:48 AM Red Shirts leader Jamal Yunos remanded for five days by farik zolkepli Jamal (right) being escorted by police at the magistrate's court in Ampang on Friday. KUALA LUMPUR: Red Shirts leader Datuk Seri Jamal Yunos has been remanded for five days to allow investigation into an alleged theft at an entertainment outlet. Earlier, the Sungai Besar Umno division chief arrived at the magistrate's court complex at about 10.15am Friday for his remand hearing. Hordes of his supporters and media members were waiting at the court compound. Police arrested Jamal on Thursday while nine of his friends were arrested on Wednesday night. They were detained to assist investigations into a theft that allegedly took place at an entertainment outlet in Ampang, one of several establishments, which the group had raided. One of the owner of the premises claimed that several items went missing after Jamal had raided the outlet. Jamal and his friends were being investigated under Section 395 of the Penal Code. The section deals with punishment for gang-robbery and states that whoever commits the crime faces a maximum 20 yearsâ€™ jail and whipping. Jamal told reporters on Thursday that he was prepared to be arrested as long as the issue at hand, which was illegal gambling, was addressed. <> <>
